intro: Guatteria bibracteata, commonly known as the yellow star apple, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. The plant produces yellow or orange fruits that are edible and have a sweet, juicy pulp. It thrives in humid, shady environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and edible fruits, it is cultivated in some regions for both horticultural and culinary purposes.
